required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Reverse HFpEF: Ketogenic Reversal of Heart Failure With Preserved Ejection Fraction Study
clinical_study.official_title: Reverse HFpEF: Ketogenic Reversal of Heart Failure With Preserved Ejection Fraction Study

brief_summary.textblock: This protocol is a prospective pilot study utilizing the intervention of a medically supervised, registered nurse and registered diabetes educator coached low-carbohydrate, ketogenic diet to examine the impact it has as a treatment for heart failure with preserved ejection fraction.

primary_outcome.description: Change in score on the Minnesota Living with Heart Failure Quality of Life (MLHFQ) Questionnaire for the HFpEF cohort. Max. Score = 105 Min. Score = 0 A reduced score means improvement of heart failure symptoms; better outcome

Change in score on the Pulmonary Arterial Hypertension-Symptoms and Impact (PAH-SYMPACT) Questionnaire for the PH-HFpEF cohort. Max. Score = 89 Min. Score = 0 A reduced score means improvement of pulmonary hypertension heart failure symptoms; better outcome

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Metabolic Health: Weight
secondary_outcome.description: Weight in kilograms (kg)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Metabolic Health: Glucose
secondary_outcome.description: Glucose in milligrams per deciliter (mg/dL)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Metabolic Health: Insulin
secondary_outcome.description: Insulin in microinternational unit per milliliter (uIU/mL)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Metabolic Health: Homeostatic Model Assessment for Insulin Resistance (HOMA-IR)
secondary_outcome.description: Insulin and glucose are multiplied then divided by 405 to report HOMA-IR

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Metabolic Health: Albumin
secondary_outcome.description: Albumin in grams per deciliter (g/dL)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Metabolic Health: Bilirubin total
secondary_outcome.description: Bilirubin total in milligrams per deciliter (mg/dL)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Metabolic Health: Alanine Transaminase (ALT)
secondary_outcome.description: ALT in units per liter (U/L)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Metabolic Health: Aspartate Aminotransferase (AST)
secondary_outcome.description: AST in units per liter (U/L)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Metabolic Health: Alkaline Phosphatase (ALP)
secondary_outcome.description: ALP in units per liter (U/L)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Metabolic Health: High Sensitivity C-Reactive Protein (HS-CRP)
secondary_outcome.description: HS-CRP in milligrams per deciliter (mg/dL)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Metabolic Health: Triglycerides
secondary_outcome.description: triglyceride in milligrams per deciliter (mg/dL)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Metabolic Health: High Density Lipoprotein (HDL)
secondary_outcome.description: HDL in milligrams per deciliter (mg/dL)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Metabolic Health: Hemoglobin A1c
secondary_outcome.description: hemoglobin A1c in percent (%)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Metabolic Health: Body Mass Index (BMI)
secondary_outcome.description: Weight and height will be combined to report BMI in kg/m^2

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Physical Function: 6 Minute Walk Test (6MWT)
secondary_outcome.description: 6-minute walk test is reported in meters (m) of how far a subject walks in 6 minutes

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Physical Function: Maximum Oxygen Consumption (VO2max)
secondary_outcome.description: VO2 max is reported in liters per minute (L/min) while performing a cardiopulmonary exercise test (CPET)

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Physical Function: Maximum Work
secondary_outcome.description: Maximum work achieved while performing a cardiopulmonary exercise test (CPET) is reported in watts (W)

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Physical Function: 30 Second Sit-to-Stand test (30s STS)
secondary_outcome.description: 30s STS is reported in quantity of how many times the subject can come to a full stand from a seated position in 30 seconds (s)

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Physical Function: Leg Press - 1 Repetition Maximum
secondary_outcome.description: Leg press is reported in kilograms (kg)

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Physical Function: Chest Press - 1 Repetition Maximum
secondary_outcome.description: Chest press is reported in kilograms (kg)

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Physical Function: Leg Extension - 1 Repetition Maximum
secondary_outcome.description: Leg extension is reported in kilograms (kg)

secondary_outcome.measure: Cardiac Remodeling: Changes in the Left Ventricle (LV) size
secondary_outcome.description: This is determined by the internal diameter measurement of the LV, reported in centimeters (cm) from a subject performed echocardiogram

secondary_outcome.measure: Cardiac Remodeling: Changes in the Left Ventricle (LV) thickness
secondary_outcome.description: This is determined by a measurement of the LV wall, reported in millimeters (mm) from an echocardiogram.

secondary_outcome.measure: Cardiac Remodeling: Changes in the Left Ventricle (LV) mass
secondary_outcome.description: This is determined by a combination formula of the interventricular septum diastole (IVSd), left ventricle diastole (LVd), and posterior wall diastole (PWd), calculated by an echocardiogram and reported in grams (g).

secondary_outcome.measure: Cardiac Remodeling: Changes in Left Atrium (LA) size
secondary_outcome.description: This is determined by the internal diameter measurement of the LA, reported in centimeters (cm) from a subject performed echocardiogram.

secondary_outcome.measure: Cardiac Remodeling: Changes in Inferior Vena Cava (IVC) size
secondary_outcome.description: This is determined by the internal diameter perpendicular to the long axis of the IVC at the end-expiration, reported in centimeters (cm) from the echocardiogram.

secondary_outcome.measure: Cardiac Remodeling: Changes in estimated Right Atrial Pressure (RAP)
secondary_outcome.description: This is determined by a combination equation subtracting the venous return (VR) from the central venous pressure (CVP), reported in millimeters of mercury (mmHg) from the echocardiogram.

secondary_outcome.measure: Cardiac Remodeling: Changes in Right Ventricle Systolic Pressure (RVSP)
secondary_outcome.description: This estimates the pressure inside the artery that supplies the lung with blood, reported in millimeters of mercury (mmHg) from the echocardiogram.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in the rate of mitral annulus velocity (e')
secondary_outcome.description: e' is reported in centimeters per second (cm/s) based on a subject performed echocardiogram

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in the ratio of transmitral early peak velocity (E) by pulsed wave Doppler over e' (E/e')
secondary_outcome.description: E/e' is reported as an integer based on the transmitral early peak velocity (E) over the mitral annulus velocity (e') from a subject performed echocardiogram.

secondary_outcome.measure: PH-HFpEF Only Hemodynamics: Changes in Right Atrial Pressure (RAP)
secondary_outcome.description: This is determined by a combination equation subtracting the venous return (VR) from the central venous pressure (CVP), reported in millimeters of mercury (mmHg) from the echocardiogram.

secondary_outcome.measure: PH-HFpEF Only Hemodynamics: Changes in Pulmonary Artery Pressure (PAP)
secondary_outcome.description: This is calculated from systolic, by Tricuspid Regurgitation maximum (TRmax) and diastolic, by Pulmonary Regurgitation-end velocity (PR-end) pulmonary artery pressures, reported in millimeters of mercury (mmHg) from the echocardiogram.

secondary_outcome.measure: PH-HFpEF Only Hemodynamics: Changes in Pulmonary Artery Occlusive Pressure (PAOP)
secondary_outcome.description: This is determined by the pressure value of the pulmonary artery once it's occluded during a Right Heart Catheterization (RHC), measured in millimeters of mercury (mmHg).

secondary_outcome.measure: PH-HFpEF Only Hemodynamics: Changes in Pulmonary Vascular Resistance (PVR)
secondary_outcome.description: Left Atrial Pressure (LAP), Pulmonary Artery Pressure (PAP) and Cardiac Output (CO) are combined to report the PVR in Wood Units (WU) from a Right Heart Catheterization (RHC).

secondary_outcome.measure: PH-HFpEF Only Hemodynamics: Changes in Cardiac Output (CO)
secondary_outcome.description: Stoke Volume (SV) and Heart Rate (HR) are combined to report CO in liters per minute (L/min) from the right heart catheterization.

secondary_outcome.measure: PH-HFpEF Only Hemodynamics: Changes in Cardiac Index (CI)
secondary_outcome.description: Cardiac Output (CO) and Body Surface Area (BSA) are combined to report CI in liters per minute per meters squared (L/min/m^2) from a Right Heart Catherization (RHC).

arm_group.description: Patients diagnosed with obesity related heart failure with preserved ejection fraction(HFpEF)
Patients diagnosed with obesity related pulmonary hypertension heart failure with preserved ejection fraction (PH-HFpEF)

intervention.description: Ketogenic diet intervention that is high in fat and low in carbohydrates, causing the body to induce a state of metabolic ketosis, whereby fat is broken down into ketones to provide an energy source for the body.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adults (age 21-80) who meet clinical signs and symptoms of heart failure based on clinical assessment.
- The subject must meet at least one of the following hemodynamic criteria for HFpEF of PH-HFpEF by right heart catheterization (RHC) within 6 months of screening visit;
A) HFpEF:
1. At rest: mean pulmonary artery occlusions pressure (PAOP) > 15, pulmonary vascular resistance (PVR) < 3 Wood Units, or
2. HFpEF with fluid challenge, defined as increase in PAOP post 500 cc fluid bolus: mean PAOP > 18, PVR < 3 Wood Units, or
3. HFpEF with exercise, defined as peak mean PAOP > 17, PVR < 3 Wood Units if age < 50 or peak mean PAOP > 19 and PVR < 3 Wood Units if age >= 50
B) PH-HFpEF:
1. At rest: mean pulmonary artery occlusion pressure (PAOP) > 15, mean pulmonary artery pressure (PAP) >= 25, pulmonary vascular resistance (PVR) > 3 Wood Units, or
2. PH-HFpEF with fluid challenge, defined as increase in PAOP post 500 cc fluid bolus: mean PAOP > 18, mean PAP >= 25, PVR > 3 Wood Units, or
3. PH-HFpEF with exercise, defined as peak mean PAOP > 17, peak mean PAP > 30, peak PVR > 1.34 Wood Units if age < 50 or peak mean PAOP > 19, peak mean PAP > 33, and PVR < 2.1 Wood Units if age >= 50
- The subject also must meet criteria for metabolic syndrome, defined as: Abdominal obesity (BMI > 30 kg/m2 or abdominal obesity, waist circumference > 102 cm men, > 88 cm women) AND 2 of the following;
a. Currently being treated for systemic hypertension or blood pressure (BP) >= 135/85 b. Glucose intolerance with diagnosis of type 2 diabetes, or fasting blood glucose 110-125 mg/dL or hemoglobin A1c > 6% c. Triglycerides >= 150, or on treatment for high triglycerides d. HDL < 40 men, < 50 women, or on treatment for high triglycerides
- If the subject is on pulmonary hypertension specific vasodilators, they must be on stable medical therapy without changes to pulmonary vasodilator medication within 3 months prior to screening visit.
- The subject must have also had a cardiopulmonary exercise test within 6 months of screening visit.
- The subject must have also had an echocardiogram within 6 months of screening visit.
- The subject must have demonstrated stable weight (less that 5% weight loss) 3 months prior to screening visit. (They cannot already be losing weight).
- The subject owns and uses a smartphone or tablet.
- Must speak English
Exclusion Criteria:
- The subject is already on a significant weight loss trajectory prior to study entry.
- The subject cannot be on an alternative diet plan or strategy (e.g., Weight Watchers, Nutrisystem, Ornish).
- Left ventricular ejection fraction < 50%.
- Severe valvular disease by echocardiogram or dysfunctional prosthetic valve.
- Active pericardial disease (moderate or large pericardial effusion or constrictive pericarditis).
- Active coronary ischemia defined by abnormal stress test, angiogram, or coronary CT angiography per investigator.
- Prolonged corrected QT interval (QTc) > 450 ms
- Significant lung disease on pulmonary function tests (PFT's) within the 6 months of screening visit, (Both post-bronchodilator values and pre-bronchodilator values must meet exclusion criteria. If either post- or pre-bronchodilator values do not, the subject may be included) defined as either:
1. Irreversible obstructive airways disease (post-bronchodilator forced expiratory volume/forced vital capacity (FEV1/FVC) < 70% predicted) or
2. Restrictive lung disease (FVC < 70% predicted. If total lung capacity (TLC) is >= 70%, it is acceptable to have an FVC of < 70%) or
3. More than mild radiographic pulmonary disease as determine don CT scan within the past 2 years per investigator.
- History of non-adherence to diuretics within 3 months of screening visit.
- History or recurrent severe hypokalemia, potassium < 3.0 mg/dL.
- History of kidney stones, gout, or gallbladder disease unless in the opinion of the investigator it will not impact the safety of the patient
- C-peptide < 0.5 ng/mL (increased risk of diabetic ketoacidosis (DKA))
- Uncorrected anemia (hemoglobin < 10 g/dL).
- Unable to participate in the comprehensive ketogenic diet program, including biometric data acquisition and data entry (glucometer self-stick and smartphone use).
- Unable or unwilling to prepare meals for self.
- Unable to perform quantitative cardia testing regimen (cardiopulmonary exercise testing, 6-minute walk).
- Subject is pregnant or planning to become pregnant in the next 14 months.

facility.name: National Jewish Health and University of Colorado Denver
